actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Agriculture.
Referred to Subcommittee on Agricultural Research.
Committee on Agriculture requested executive comment from Agriculture Department.
Subcommittee on Agricultural Research. Hearings held.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Agricultural Research, Conservation, Forestry and General Legislation

official_title: A bill to designate the Sipsey River as a component of the National Wild and Scenic Rivers System, to designate certain areas as additions to the Sipsey Wilderness, and to preserve over thirty thousand acres of pristine natural treasure in the Bankhead National Forest for the aesthetic and recreational benefit of future generations of Alabamians, and for other purposes.
short_title: Sipsey Wild and Scenic River and Sipsey Wilderness Addition Act of 1986

summary.text: Sipsey Wild and Scenic River and Sipsey Wilderness Addition Act of 1986 - Title I: Wild and Scenic River Designation - Amends the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act to designate Sipsey Fork, West Fork, Alabama, as a component of the Wild and Scenic Rivers System. Directs the Secretary of Agriculture to construct a dam to create a lake for recreational use in either Brushy Creek or Flint Creek watershed, Bankhead National Forest, Alabama. Directs the Secretary to construct a road and recreational facilities adjacent to such lake. Requires the Secretary to protect the water quality of such lake. Title II: Wilderness Designation - Expands the Sipsey Wilderness in the William B. Bankhead National Forest, Alabama. Provides that the RARE II (second roadless area review and evaluation) final environmental statement (dated January 1979) with respect to national forest system lands in Alabama shall not be subject to judicial review. Releases national forest system lands in Alabama which were reviewed in the RARE II program from further review by the Department of Agriculture, pending the revision of initial national forest management plans. Releases lands in Alabama reviewed in the RARE II program and not designated as wilderness from management as wilderness areas. Prohibits the Department of Agriculture from conducting any further statewide roadless area review and evaluation of national forest system lands in Alabama without express congressional authorization. States that the provisions above shall also apply to national forest system roadless lands in Alabama which are less than 5,000 acres in size.

titles.title: Sipsey Wild and Scenic River and Sipsey Wilderness Addition Act of 1986

A bill to designate the Sipsey River as a component of the National Wild and Scenic Rivers System, to designate certain areas as additions to the Sipsey Wilderness, and to preserve over thirty thousand acres of pristine natural treasure in the Bankhead National Forest for the aesthetic and recreational benefit of future generations of Alabamians, and for other purposes.
